extendedInfo.description: Ads have been completely removed!! I decided they just weren't worth the effort, or the annoyance. The app once again requires zero permissions.If you like this app, please buy the donate version to support my education :)The Alarm Clock shortcut mysteriously disappeared in Android 2.2! After investigating this, I set to work devising a solution. Alarm Clock Launcher puts an easy one-tap Alarm Clock shortcut in your App List, solving the mystery of the missing Alarm Clock!It is particularly useful when half-awake ;)If you have any trouble getting this app to work, please try "Alarm Clock Launcher Old", an older version of Alarm Clock Launcher that may work on more devices.Note: This app is only useful for devices that don't have a manufacturer overlay with an alarm clock built in.

reviews.title: was good before last update!
reviews.comment: the shortcut after the lsat update is not working. I have uninstalled it and I\'m going to download the new app.

reviews.title: Don\'t Update!!!!!
reviews.comment: Latest update kills the functionality. For shortcut to alarm settings, search for Alarms Shortcut in the Play Store.

reviews.title: Thanks guys!

reviews.title: Htc rezound - force closes

reviews.title: perfect
reviews.comment: This should be included as part of the system, it is so nice having a quick launch to the alarms!!! Thank you so much. This app is perfect.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works like a charm
reviews.comment: Exactly what I\'ve been looking for!!! I use the Digital Clock Widget, which displays the next alarm next to the clock, and I can set which app to run when tapping on the widget. I want to run Alarm directly from there; stock Motorola ROM supported it, but CM7 doesn\'t, which was my only gripe with CM7. This app fills the void. Hooray!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Thank you! This works like its suppose to. Have missed since Froyo took it away...Moto droid 1!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Just goes to desk clock page. I can get there just by pressing the clock on my home screen. Useless....
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It works well. Why break it?
reviews.comment: Why does this require network access now? Are you trying to implement ads? And what\'s with the new icon? Poor choices... I\'ll see if the What\'s new field gets utilized for this update but will probably end up detaching the current version from the market.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Get me to the desk clock. What\'s the point? I can get there using Clock app. Still need the same 2 clicks 2 access actually alarms. Useless!!! HTC DHD
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: 5 star BEFORE the ics update
reviews.comment: Ever since the ics  update I cannot use this app very disappointing as this was an app I used multiple times a day PLEASE SEND AN UPDATE!!!!!

reviews.comment: Apparently it doesn\'t support my device. ._. But I had a stock app of this... *sighs* why did I have to delete that.

reviews.comment: It does exactly what the stock clock widget does, which is open the clock/etc panel. that\'s fine with me though since I just wanted a 1x1 shortcut.

reviews.comment: Eh, all this does is link to the clock... which I could do by tapping the desk clock widget anyway. Direct link to alarm would be nice.
